result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah Wheeler

records.addlTxt:
OFF THE RECORD- Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Jeremiah Wheeler not in court, in custody.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Discussion with parties placed off the record. Case remains calendared as previosuly set for Final Pre-Trial and Jury Trial dates.
Defense counsel further requests to be heard on bail. Arguments heard as to bail. Court denied defense motion for modification of bail for today's purposes. Case remains calendared as previously set.

Defendant Jeremiah Wheeler in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Jeremiah Wheeler in custody.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Arraignment. All parties appeared via zoom. Original Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Motion for Bail Modification.

Defendant Jeremiah Wheeler in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Jeremiah Wheeler in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an arraignment. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Case in court for arraignment in Branch 16.  Arraignment scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jeremiah Wheeler in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran; both appear by video.  Defendant Jeremiah Wheeler in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Hermann. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy. Defense requests an arraignment.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Arraignment scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremiah Wheeler in court via zoom and with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Jeremiah Wheeler in custody.  Alexander Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  For reasons as stated on the record, the decision by Commissioner to accept the Substition of Judge is vacated because it was accepted in legal error and doesn't comply with State Statute 971.20(6).  Case remains with original assigned judge.   Motion to modify bail is withdrawn by defense counsel.   mn

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark, Br. 17.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grayson, Br. 16.

Defendant Jeremiah Wheeler in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Jeremiah Wheeler in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case in court for preliminary hearing. State's witness is unavailable. State requests an adjournment. Defense objects. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. 
Defense request to be heard as to bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 032291,
Payable Number: 997493,
Receipt Number: 22RP013701,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Jeremiah Wheeler not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CLERK ERROR: CASH BAIL ENTERED AS 1,000.00 WHEN IT SHOULD HAVE BEEN 10,000.00. 

CORRECTION: CASH BAIL ON ORIGINAL ENTRY CHANGED FROM 1,000.00 TO 10,000.00 TODAY, SINCE IT IS STILL WITHIN THE GRACE PERIOD FOR CHANGES TO BE MADE.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

ADDRESS INFO for Jeremiah Wheeler
Current: 905 Fairway point drive, Riverdale, GA 30274 United States  (Effective: 03-08-2022)
Prior: 4508 W. Villard Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Jeremiah Wheeler in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Jeremiah Wheeler in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeremiah Wheeler appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
